data.title: What is carotid artery stenosis?
data.normalized_content: Carotid stenosis is a condition in which the vessel wall thickens due to atherosclerotic plaques, gradually narrowing the vessel lumen. The carotid arteries on both sides are main branches originating from the thoracic aorta, passing in the carotid trough along both sides of the neck to supply blood to the brain. Blood flow to the brain is therefore also reduced. When the stenosis is severe, it can cause brain damage due to anemia. The degree of brain damage, more or less, will manifest clinically with signs of transient ischemic attack or stroke. (first)

data.title: Causes of carotid artery stenosis
data.normalized_content: The most common cause of carotid artery stenosis is atherosclerotic plaque on the artery wall. In addition, some other risk factors that can cause the disease include: Dyslipidemia High blood pressure Diabetes Smoking Having a family member with carotid or coronary artery disease Obesity Being sedentary

data.title: Symptoms of carotid artery stenosis
data.normalized_content: Transient ischemic attack is the most important warning sign of stroke, showing focal neurological impairment (numbness and weakness on one side, blindness on one side, difficulty speaking...) that progresses over a period of time. It lasts a few minutes, then goes away completely. There are patients with only one symptom, on the other hand, there are patients with many symptoms at the same time. The standard for diagnosing transient ischemic attack recommended by the American Heart Association is the absence of cerebral infarct lesions on brain CT or MRI scans. (2) Numbness and weakness in one side of the limbs, blindness on one side, difficulty speaking, etc. are manifestations of focal neurological impairment. The above signs of neurological impairment are more severe from the beginning. or prolonged is a sure sign of a stroke. Stroke is confirmed when there is an image of cerebral infarction on CT or MRI of the brain. The risk of stroke will be reduced by more than 50%, if people with carotid artery stenosis over 70% have carotid endarterectomy. However, cases of extracranial carotid artery stenosis often do not have any symptoms until accidentally discovered or when complications occur. Therefore, regular examinations for people with high risk factors for carotid artery stenosis are extremely necessary, so that the disease can be promptly detected and treated.

data.title: method for diagnosing carotid artery stenosis
data.normalized_content: To diagnose carotid artery stenosis, the doctor will first conduct an examination with a stethoscope along the carotid artery to detect a murmur at the stenosis site. Duplex ultrasound can evaluate the degree of stenosis and the morphology of atherosclerotic plaques with thrombus or ulceration. At the same time, ultrasound also provides additional hemodynamic parameters such as peak systolic velocity at the stenosis site, which is also a standard to evaluate the degree of stenosis. This is the first choice diagnostic method because of its safety and low cost. In addition, there are a number of other disease diagnosis methods such as CT scan or magnetic resonance angiography (MRA). These are modern techniques that not only provide images to identify stenotic lesions but can also evaluate the morphology of the entire carotid artery from its origin in the aortic arch to its branches in the brain. In addition, brain CT or MRI images also help evaluate cerebral perfusion status in cases after stroke. Digital angiography (DSA): indicated when considering carotid artery stenting. This is considered the most accurate method of diagnosing vascular conditions, the gold standard in diagnosing vascular diseases. data.title: How to treat carotid artery stenosis?
data.normalized_content: To provide appropriate treatment for carotid artery stenosis, doctors also rely on the degree of carotid artery stenosis, whether the stenosis has symptoms or not, and the patient's health status. In the early stages of the disease, patients are often prescribed medication and lifestyle changes. (3) Change your lifestyle Quit smoking; Limit alcohol; Do exercise; Eat less salt. Medications Antiplatelet drugs aspirin 81 - 325mg or clopidogrel 75mg per day depending on the patient's condition. Optimal medical treatment of underlying diseases, which are risk factors such as hypertension, diabetes, fat metabolism disorders... The treatment goal recommended by the European Society of Cardiology is to keep blood pressure <140 /90 mmHg, low-density lipoprotein (LDL) <1.8 mmol/L (70 mg/dL). In the late, advanced stages of the disease, doctors may recommend surgery or carotid artery stenting. Carotid artery stenting Carotid artery stenting is indicated for patients with severe carotid artery stenosis of 70% or more, with or without symptoms of cerebral infarction or transient ischemic attack such as : sudden weakness, numbness of half the face, half the body or one limb, difficulty speaking, loss of vision on one side; especially in the following cases: Young patients; The location of carotid artery stenosis is difficult to operate; Having accompanying medical diseases increases the risk of complications and complications of surgery; Patients with narrowed vessels after radiation or surgery. Carotid artery stenting is a procedure to widen the narrowed carotid artery, preventing or treating stroke. This is a non-surgical method, performed by inserting the instrument through the artery puncture hole and then placing it on the damaged artery to help widen the narrowed carotid artery, pressing the atherosclerotic plaque against the artery wall. vessels, supporting blood circulation to the brain. Carotid artery stent placement is considered a minimally invasive endovascular intervention method, shortening hospital stay compared to carotid endarterectomy. This technique has little effect on the whole body and brings good results if chosen for the right indications and the doctor performing it is experienced. Open the carotid artery at the narrowed area and remove atherosclerotic plaque. A technique called carotid laminectomy is the technique that gives the best results. After removing the atherosclerotic plaque, the vessel wall can be closed directly or expanded with a vascular patch to prevent post-operative restenosis. Surgery can be performed under local anesthesia or general anesthesia.

Đặt stent động mạch cảnh

Đặt stent động mạch cảnh được chỉ định cho các bệnh nhân hẹp động mạch cảnh mức độ nặng từ 70% trở lên, có hoặc không có triệu chứng nhồi máu não hoặc thiếu máu não cục bộ tạm thời thoáng qua như: đột ngột yếu, tê nửa mặt, nửa người hoặc 1 bên tay chân, khó nói, mất thị lực 1 bên; đặc biệt là trong các trường hợp: Bệnh nhân trẻ; Vị trí hẹp động mạch cảnh khó phẫu thuật; Có bệnh nội khoa đi kèm, có nguy cơ tăng tai biến, biến chứng của phẫu thuật; Bệnh nhân bị hẹp mạch sau tia xạ hoặc phẫu thuật. Đặt stent động mạch cảnh là thủ thuật nhằm mở rộng lòng động mạch cảnh bị thu hẹp, phòng ngừa hay điều trị đột quỵ. Đây là phương pháp không phẫu thuật, được tiến hành bằng cách đưa dụng cụ qua lỗ chọc kim động mạch sau đó đưa lên vị trí động mạch bị tổn thương giúp mở rộng lòng động mạch cảnh bị hẹp, ép mảng xơ vữa vào thành động mạch, hỗ trợ cho việc lưu thông máu lên não. Đặt stent động mạch cảnh được xem là một phương pháp can thiệp nội mạch ít xâm lấn, rút ngắn thời gian nằm viện so với phương pháp phẫu thuật bóc tách nội mạc động mạch cảnh. Kỹ thuật này ít ảnh hưởng tới toàn thân và mang lại kết quả tốt nếu được lựa chọn đúng chỉ định và bác sĩ thực hiện có kinh nghiệm. Mở vào lòng động mạch cảnh vị trí hẹp, lấy bỏ mảng xơ vữa động mạch. Kỹ thuật được gọi là phẫu thuật bóc lớp trong động mạch cảnh là kỹ thuật cho kết quả tốt nhất. Sau khi lấy bỏ mảng xơ vữa, thành mạch có thể được đóng trực tiếp hoặc mở rộng thêm với 1 miếng vá mạch máu để phòng tái hẹp sau mổ. Phẫu thuật có thể được thực hiện dưới gây tê tại chỗ vùng cổ hoặc mê toàn thân.

data.title: Choose surgery to remove the internal layer or put a carotid artery stent? | carotid artery stenosis
data.normalized_content: Symptomatic patients (after stroke or transient ischemic attack <6 months): Carotid artery stenosis 70-99%: Class I A level carotid artery dissection is recommended; If the surgical risk is high, carotid artery stenting is indicated with the recommended level IIa B. Carotid artery stenosis 50-69%: Carotid artery dissection is recommended at Class IIa B level; Carotid artery stent placement at recommended level IIb B. Patients without symptoms Carotid artery stenosis 60-99%, patients with a chance of survival >5 years: Recommended carotid intimal laminectomy at Class IIa level B; Carotid artery stenting with recommendation IIb B. data.title: Postoperative monitoring and intervention | carotid artery stenosis
data.normalized_content: After surgery or intervention, patients are instructed to re-examine every 1-3 months. Cardiovascular risk factors such as high blood pressure, diabetes, fat metabolism disorders... need to be optimally adjusted to avoid recurrence as well as narrowing of arteries in other locations. Ultrasound check after 3-6 months and every 1-2 years to evaluate results and monitor.
data.content: Sau mổ hoặc can thiệp, người bệnh được hướng dẫn tái khám mỗi 1-3 tháng. Các yếu tố nguy cơ tim mạch như cao huyết áp, đái tháo đường, rối loạn chuyển hóa mỡ… cần được điều chỉnh tối ưu để tránh tái phát cũng như hẹp động mạch các vị trí khác. Siêu âm kiểm tra sau 3-6 tháng và mỗi 1-2 năm để đánh giá kết quả và theo dõi.

data.title: Preventing carotid artery stenosis
data.normalized_content: Carotid stenosis is a dangerous disease but it is difficult to recognize because the disease has no symptoms or vague symptoms, easily confused with other common diseases. Therefore, people at high risk of disease need to regularly visit reputable medical facilities for early detection and treatment. (4) Mild symptoms such as dizziness and lightheadedness make the patient inattentive, but are one of the causes leading to the patient having a cerebral infarction. Many cases of stroke arrive late at the hospital. Therefore, patients with chronic diseases such as hypertension, diabetes, dyslipidemia for many years or those with other risk factors including: smokers, obese, high blood fat, exercise, diet high in sugar, high in fat... you should have your carotid artery checked.

Do đó, các đối tượng có nguy cơ mắc bệnh cao cần thường xuyên thăm khám tại các cơ sở y tế uy tín để sớm phát hiện và điều trị. Vì thế, bệnh nhân mắc các bệnh lý mãn tính như tăng huyết áp, đái tháo đường, rối loạn lipid máu nhiều năm hoặc những người mang yếu tố nguy cơ khác gồm: người hút thuốc lá, béo phì, mỡ máu cao, ít vận động, chế độ ăn nhiều đường, nhiều chất béo… nên đi kiểm tra động mạch cảnh.

data.title: Screening for carotid artery stenosis
data.normalized_content: Carotid artery stenosis has few characteristic signs, so screening to detect the disease early plays a key role, thereby monitoring and having effective treatment and intervention strategies to prevent stroke. According to Dr. Nguyen Anh Dung, regular health checks and screening for cardiovascular diseases are necessary for each person to prevent disease. This is even more necessary for people with high risk factors. Accordingly, people over 50 years old, with high blood pressure, dyslipidemia, smokers, diabetes, obesity, people with a sedentary lifestyle, etc., even without symptoms, still need regular check-ups and cardiovascular disease screening. For patients with carotid artery stenosis who suddenly develop symptoms such as distorted mouth, paralysis of one side of the body or only one arm/leg, difficulty speaking or not being able to speak, loss of vision on one side, balance disorders... emergency treatment is required. right at hospitals and specialized stroke treatment facilities with vascular intervention so that doctors can diagnose and prescribe appropriate treatment.
